Package io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.encdec

Class Encoders

java.lang.Object
io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.encdec.Encoders
public final class Encoders extends Object
Reusable response content encoders. An encoder is simply a Function<Object,String> which is used to convert the configured response content object into the response output bytes.

  • Field Details

    • text

      public static final Function<Object,byte[]> text
      Encodes the object as a String of text (UTF-8).

    • binaryBase64

      public static Function<Object,byte[]> binaryBase64
      Encodes a byte array, InputStream or other object with a "getBytes()" method into a base-64 string.

    • content

      public static Function<Object,byte[]> content
      Loads the content at the specified destination and returns it as a byte array. The content destination may be specified by any of the following:

      InputStream - will load the contents of the stream String - will load the contents of the path from the classloader. Path - will load the contents of the path as a file on the filesystem File - will load the contents of the path as a file on the filesystem URI - will load the contents of the URI URL - will load the contents of the URL

    • multipart

      public static Function<Object,byte[]> multipart
      Encodes a MultipartResponseContent object to its multipart string representation. The generated multipart content is a simple message implementing the minimal multipart content specification - you may want to find a more robust implementation if you require a more detailed multipart API.
